author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Tucson To Receive New Nonstop Chicago O’Hare Service from United AirlinesTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Tucson To Receive New Nonstop Chicago O’Hare Service from United Airlines Published on : Sunday, August 2, 2015
Adding more choices for travelers from Tucson International Airport, United Airlines is announcing it will add a daily nonstop flight to Chicago O’Hare International Airport from December 17 through April 4, 2016.
The new flights will offer connecting service throughout United’s network, including East Coast and European destinations.
SkyWest Airlines will operate the United Express flights using E175 aircraft, which are configured with 12 seats in United First, 16 Economy Plus seats and 48 seats in Economy.
“The addition of these flights will give us more opportunities to show off Tucson to visitors wanting to escape the cold this winter,” said Bonnie Allin, President and CEO of the Tucson Airport Authority. “Chicago is a critical tourism market for Tucson but it’s also important that we in Southern Arizona take advantage of this option for our own travel needs.”
In another positive schedule change, Allin noted United will use a larger 128-passenger Airbus A319 on one of its existing four daily round-trips from Tucson to Denver, starting October 25.
From TUCSON From O’HARE
Flight Depart TUS Arrive ORD Aircraft Flight Depart ORD Arrive TUS Aircraft 5530 12:15 p.m.* 4:50 p.m. E175 5533 9:20 a.m. 12 noon* E175 * Arrival /Departure time is one hour earlier effective March 13, when Daylight Saving Time goes into effect.
